name: Venezuela
description: Venezuela, officially the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, is a country in northwestern South America. It’s renowned for its diverse geography, encompassing the towering Andes Mountains, the vast Amazon rainforest, sprawling savanna, and a lengthy coastline along the Caribbean Sea and the Gulf of Venezuela.  The country possesses significant oil reserves, but faces considerable economic and political challenges. Its rich history is intertwined with indigenous cultures, Spanish colonization, and a complex struggle for independence.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city, situated in the central highlands.
quickFacts.detail: Caracas is a sprawling metropolis with a rich cultural heritage and a significant economic role.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Venezuela's population is diverse, reflecting its historical influences.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is relatively high, particularly in urban areas.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A large landmass with varied terrain.
quickFacts.detail: Venezuela is the fifth-largest country in South America.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: Indigenous languages are also spoken in certain regions.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Bolívar has undergone several revaluations due to hyperinflation.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Venezuela's economy is heavily reliant on oil exports.
quickFacts.detail: The economy has faced significant challenges in recent years.

climateData.title: Climate of Venezuela
climateData.description: Venezuela experiences a diverse range of climates due to its varied topography. The northern coast enjoys a tropical climate, while the central and southern regions have a tropical savanna climate. The Andes Mountains experience a cooler, temperate climate.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Hot and humid, with frequent rainfall, particularly along the coast.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures begin to cool, and rainfall decreases.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The coolest and driest season, with temperatures dropping in the highlands.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures rise again, and rainfall increases.

naturalWonders.name: Angel Falls
naturalWonders.description: Angel Falls is the world’s highest uninterrupted waterfall, plunging a staggering 979 meters (3,212 feet) from Auyán-tepui mountain.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in Canaima National Park, it’s a breathtaking spectacle of nature, accessible primarily by air or river.

naturalWonders.name: Serranía de los Neblinosos
naturalWonders.description: The Serranía de los Neblinosos, or 'Cloudy Mountains', is a remote and pristine mountain range in the Amazonas state, known for its unique cloud forests.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: These mountains are home to a remarkable array of endemic plant and animal species, many of which are found nowhere else on Earth.  The area is largely unexplored and offers a truly wild experience.

naturalWonders.name: Morichal Wetland
naturalWonders.description: Morichal Wetland is the largest mangrove wetland in the Amazon basin, a vital ecosystem for countless species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: It’s a crucial breeding ground for fish and birds, and plays a significant role in carbon sequestration. The area is also home to indigenous communities who depend on the wetland for their livelihoods.
viewingTips: Learn about the importance of mangroves

biodiversityCategory.name: Amazon Rainforest
biodiversityCategory.description: The Amazon Rainforest is the largest tropical rainforest in the world, covering a significant portion of northern Venezuela.

statistics.details: Approximately 60% of the rainforest is located in Venezuela.
Estimated to contain over 10,000 plant species and countless animal species.
Home to over 1,600 rivers and streams.

notableSpecies.name: Jaguar
notableSpecies.significance: Top predator of the Amazon rainforest.

notableSpecies.name: Harpy Eagle
notableSpecies.significance: One of the largest eagles in the world.

notableSpecies.name: Giant Otter
notableSpecies.significance: Highly social and intelligent aquatic mammals.

ecosystemData.title: Amazonian Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: The Amazonian ecosystem of Venezuela is a complex and interconnected web of life, characterized by its immense biodiversity and vital role in regulating the global climate.

biodiversityCategories.name: Tropical Rainforest
biodiversityCategories.description: The dominant ecosystem, characterized by high rainfall and dense vegetation.

statistics.details: Receives an average of 2,000 mm of rainfall per year.
Average temperatures range from 25 to 30 degrees Celsius.

notableSpecies.name: Poison Dart Frog
notableSpecies.significance: Known for its vibrant colors and toxic skin.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Venezuela
activities.description: Venezuela offers a wide range of outdoor activities, from exploring stunning waterfalls to trekking through lush rainforests.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the diverse landscapes of Venezuela on foot.

activities.name: Angel Falls Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek to the base of Angel Falls.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, hiking boots, waterproof gear

activities.name: Serranía de los Neblinosos Hike
activities.description: A demanding multi-day trek through the cloud forests of the Serranía de los Neblinosos.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Caribbean Sea and the Orinoco River.

activities.name: Kayaking in Morichal Wetland
activities.description: Explore the mangrove ecosystem by kayak.

activities.name: River Rafting on the Orinoco
activities.description: Experience the thrill of rafting on the Orinoco River.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, hat, gloves

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
